description: The Brooklyn Nets guard Kyrie Irving asked for a trade request after both sides failed to reach an agreement on an extension after talks about a new contract did not go to his liking. Irving shared the link to the documentary film called “Hebrews to Negroes: Wake Up Black America,” on Twitter.  He was suspended by the Nets on Nov. 3 2022 after he refused to issue the apology that NBA Commissioner Adam Silver sought for posting the link the the film. He returned after issuing an apology more than two weeks later. He missed eight games. Pressure has been mounting on Amazon to discontinue sale of the film which has a synopsis which says it “uncovers the true identity of the Children of Israel.”
metaDescription: An illustration of Nets guard Kyrie Irving who asked for a trade request after he shared a link to the an anti-semitic film and was suspended.
topicText:
Sources - Kyrie Irving asks Nets for trade ahead of deadline
Kyrie Irving delivered his trade request to the Nets on Friday after both sides failed to reach an agreement on an extension, sources told ESPN.
Kyrie Irving Asks the Nets to Trade Him
The Nets guard, who will be a free agent this summer, wants out of Brooklyn just months after he caused an uproar by linking to an antisemitic film on ...
Nets' Kyrie Irving requests trade, according to reports
Irving made the request after talks about a new contract did not go to his liking, the news outlets reported Friday. The NBA's trade deadline is Thursday. The ...
Reports: Kyrie Irving requests trade from Nets before deadline | NBA ...
All-Star guard Kyrie Irving has reportedly informed the Nets he wants to be dealt before the Feb. 9 trade deadline.
Nets' Kyrie Irving requests trade as Lakers, Suns, Mavericks emerge ...
The Nets have been informed Irving prefers to move on ahead of the Feb. 9 trade deadline — or will leave in free agency in July.
Kyrie Irving insulted by Nets putting 'championship stipulation' in ...
Irving, who has requested a trade, reportedly took the championship stipulation as a 'big insult'
